content:
image.png

I dont understand certain aspects of the rewrite tactic. I was trying to solve level 8 of the Multiplication world. I have atttached a picture of my code above for reference. After line 5, I wanted to use a targeted rewrite appealing to the associaitviy of addition but I would get an error whenever I tried to use "rw [add_assoc ac dc c]. I figured the reason why this doesn't work is because lean expects the lefthand side to be exactly of the form x + y + z where x,y,and z are natural numbers. However, if I use the untargeted version of rewrite, it seems to work exactly the way I wanted it to. Why does Lean behave like this?
Try with brackets around (a*c) etc? I must confess I'm quite surprised
If you post the error you get when you try the thing that's not working for you, that would also be helpful information
Thank you for the suggestion. It looks like it was as simple as adding parenthesis around each of the three terms.
Caleb Shank has marked this topic as resolved.
It's a bit surprising because that's obviously not what you mean, but consider f a * b which is nearly as obviously (f a) * b
I should probably explicitly mention that gotcha in NNG
